III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206 Staff qualifications
Section (1) An agency shall require a staff member who has ongoing
Description contact with children or parents to be a person who has the ability,
1

experience, education, and training to perform the duties
assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On Valentine's Day, a staff member was sexually harassing a
youth by touching his hair and thighs and making inappropriate
comments to him.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed via telephone on April 12, 2023.
Complainant stated Youth A reported the inappropriate contact
occurred over different days. Initially Staff 1 was touching his hair
and then began grabbing his thighs. On Valentine's Day, Youth A
stated he made a comment about not having a significant other
and Staff 1 responded by stating she would be his Valentine.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at Flint Detention
Center on April 13, 2023. Youth A stated he received his stipend
on Valentine's Day. He went back to the house and Staff 1 was
sitting at the table. Youth A stated Staff 1 would regularly flirt with
him. He stated he was walking through the dining room and make
a statement about not having a valentine and she responded by
saying “I’ll be your Valentine baby”. On another occasion Youth A
had some money in his hand. Staff 1 grabbed a $20 bill and put it
in her bra. Youth A stated she would caress his hair on other
occasions and has also grabbed his thigh while sitting next to him.
He felt that she meant it to be inappropriate. He stated she would
bend over in front of him and the other youth. The inappropriate
touching and comments started when he first moved in and
occurred 2-3 times a week. Youth A stated Staff 1 is no longer
working at Community Care Organization. He stated the Program
Manager (PM) is aware of his concerns. He stated when he found
out Staff 1 quit, he sent her a text message to her work phone and
tried to “make a move”. PM had the phone and addressed it with
Youth A. At that point, Youth A explained to PM that Staff 1 had
been “leaving signals”. He told her about the incidents that
occurred, and PM said maybe she was just trying to be nice. He
didn’t feel like he was believed.
Program Manager (PM) was interviewed via telephone on
April 21, 2023. PM confirmed that Staff 1 is no longer employed
with the agency. PM stated Youth A sent Staff 1 an inappropriate
text on February 25, 2023, after she left the agency. PM was in
possession of the phone since Staff 1 was no longer employed
and approached Youth A about it. PM stated Youth A never
disclosed any concerns regarding Staff 1 touching him or
speaking to him in an inappropriate manner. In addition, she
2

stated no other youth past, or present have ever disclosed
anything regarding her saying inappropriate things or
inappropriate touching. PM stated Staff 1 was scheduled to work
on February 14, 2023.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on April 21, 2023. Staff 1
confirmed that she is no longer employed with the agency. Her
last day of employment was February 25, 2023. Staff 1 stated she
never made any inappropriate comments to Youth A, or any other
youth and she has never inappropriate touched him or anyone
else.
Follow up email with Program Manager (PM) on May 17, 2023.
PM advised there are no current residents who resided in the IL
home while Staff 1 was employed with the agency.
DHHS Worker reported during a video conference held on
May 10, 2023, there were no findings.
Documents reviewed:
 Personnel file for Staff 1 was reviewed. Staff 1 received a
written reprimand and 3-day suspension on January 24,
2023, due to leaving youth unattended. Staff received a
written reprimand-2nd warning and 3-day suspension on
February 24, 2023, for not having her work phone with her
during her shift and not responding to attempts to contact
her within 15 minutes.
 Text messages sent from Youth A to Staff 1 were reviewed.
Youth A attempted to contact Staff 1 on her work phone
after her employment ended. Youth A stated “I was looking
at you and u fine ass. I’m trying to hit”.
 Agency staff schedule for week of February 12, 2023-
February 18, 2023, document Staff 1 was scheduled to
work on February 14, 2023.
Analysis Based on information gathered through interviews and review of
documents, the agency is found in compliance as there was no
evidence to support the allegations.
Additional allegations in complaint:
 There was an incident during which he thought he heard
another youth and a staff fighting upstairs, but he did not
see what happened. This allegation was previously
investigated in 2023C0000208.
3

 There is a staff member who walks in on youths in the
shower. This allegation was previously investigated in
2023C0000210.
 He witnessed a staff member, Staff 1, smoking marijuana
with youth in the independent living home. Youth C did not
remember when this occurred, and he did not report this to
anyone. This allegation is being investigated in
2023C0000299.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
